caption: Expropriate is an extremely powerful card that will guarantee you at least one extra turn as well as gaining control of a number of permanents your opponents control
As mentioned previously Reconnaissance allows you to protect Narset when she attacks, however it can also be used to remove enemy creatures from combat allowing to essential negate their combat step

Venser, the Sojourner is a very useful planeswalker as his +2 ability can untap mana in order to hold up a counterspell or untap Narset giving her pseudo-viligance, his -1 allows Narset to be unblockable, and his -8 is game winning as when casting spells for free from Narset you also exile your opponents permanents

Inexorable Tide is a fantastic utility enchantment for a superfriends deck as if you get a planeswalker from Narsets ability and 3 other noncreature, nonland cards you just play the planeswalker first then cast the other spells, proliferating 3 times effectively giving the planeswalker and additional 3 loyalty counters, which often times is enough to reach their ultimate ability

Time Stretch as I have mentioned is very good at stalling out the game and giving you additional combat steps with Narset allowing you to take over, not only this but it ensures your opponents cannot interfere with you in a major way for a number of turns

Karn, the Great creator has a great passive ability that shuts down all artifacts on your opponents' boards, effectively reducing all their mana rocks to nothing, I have found this to be extremely effective if you can play him before an opponent gets out a big threat as it sets them back an incredible amount

Scroll rack was a huge investment for this deck with a whopping Â£50 price tag it may look inconspicuous, however, being able to manipulate the top cards of your library is extremely important for this deck and putting powerful spells on top of your library can often be gamewinning

Sword of Feast and Famine is one of Magic's most famous artifacts and it is not hard to see why, giving protection from both Black and Green in addition to untapping lands on combat damage allows you to chain powerful effects between your first and second main phase, while also doing extra damage and gaining card advantage by forcing them to discard

Oath of Teferi is one of the better enchantments in this deck, allowing you to blink a permanent giving you extra mana or pseudo-vigilance, and allows you to activate planeswalker abilities twice on each of your turns ensures you are able to ultimate your planeswalkers exceedingly quickly and win the game from there
